channel.title: How to edit the game
channel.description: I am a complete noob with runescape private servers...I have literally been up 2 days straight googling around and searching forums trying to find tutorials on this. I don't understand what 317 and 508 is, all I know is that I have something that says Moparscape 3.2 and another one that says ipchanger client. How can I put new models in here? If I need to change code to make the models work, how do I make the code viewable/editable? any help would be greatly appreciated. :) It would also help a lot if you could point me somewhere with tutorials for people that don't know anything about this. I know a little about programming but it's mostly c++ and not jave. Thanks

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @WestSideMass WestSideMass
item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

The source is the whole game.
The MoparScape client is basically the game and the source packed together. I consider it training wheels for the big servers.
If you really want to start off right, I suggest this:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


It has a Client download, and a Source download. Run the Source first, and then the client.

Read full topic

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @goldragon83 goldragon83
item.description:
@goldragon83 wrote:

I have the moparscape client. So you’re saying I need to download the source too? The game runs right on the client, so if that is what you’re saying, what is the source even for?

Read full topic

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @WestSideMass WestSideMass
item.description:
@WestSideMass wrote:

This is the download section where you can download other peoples sources and clients. You can also download some helpful programs. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/board,49.0.html

A compiler is basically a batch or .bat notepad program that tells you if you did anything wrong with your coding, and it also saves everything from your .java files into your .class files.

If you use someone elses’ source and client, you should not have to know much Java, just change the titles and everything. If you plan on making major changes to your server, you will have to know some Java.

There are plenty of versions of RuneScape Sources like 317, 508, 525 but trust me, you want to start off with 317s as they are the easiest to code and understand.

The source is basically what your server will look like internally, your client is what you play the server on. It is what determines what your items, monsters, and objects look like. If you have a 317 source, the best thing to do would be to have a 317 client.

Sprites are your GUI basically. It is what your client looks like. They have your backbases, your invback, your mapback, etc. You shouldn’t have to do much with these.

Your models are the custom items and NPCs you add and is client sided. If you want to add an Item or NPC, there is a Model section for that on the forums and there is a wide variety to choose from. Every item should have 2 models, the drop model which is what it looks like on the ground, and the inventory model. When you add the 2 model files into your model folder, you should have to go into Class8.java and add the integer, or Class5.java for NPCs.

The Client has the same basic idea, when you change something, you need to compile, or save it.

I hope this summed up the basic idea for you. Just remember, Ctrl + F is your friend.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

Read full topic

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

goldragon83:

Okay…well I don’t really know how to compile it… Is there a way to do it in notepad? I remember programming a little in java a long time ago and I swear I made a hello world program from notepad. Lol…anyway

A basic java compiler looks like:

@echo off javac *.java pause

Save as compiler.bat in notepad.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

goldragon83:

Thanks, Kpoop…but I still have no idea where to start with this. What is 317!? Is it the moparscape client thing that I downloaded? And anyway, half the stuff I read in the client file I can’t even tell what it does. I doesn’t anybody know how I can get more help with this? Like a detailed explanation?

317 is the 2005-2006 version of RuneScape. 508 is one of the newer versions of RuneScape. Clients read off of class files, and they are un-readable to humans because they are coded in things computers use to read to send data. You code in .java extention files, and when you compile, it compiles these codes into the .class extention files.

Read full topic

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @goldragon83 goldragon83
item.description:
@goldragon83 wrote:

Thanks, Kpoop…but I still have no idea where to start with this. What is 317!? Is it the moparscape client thing that I downloaded? And anyway, half the stuff I read in the client file I can’t even tell what it does. I doesn’t anybody know how I can get more help with this? Like a detailed explanation?

Read full topic

item.title: How to edit the game
item.dc:creator: @kpop kpop
item.description:
@kpop wrote:

You don’t need to open the .class files. Editing the .java files is all you need to do to change your client and source.
Thats why in “closed” sources and clients you only see .class files and the run file. The owners don’t want you tampering with their work.

Also if you’re trying to change something in-game then most likely you need to edit your source not client.
If you’re as new to this as you say i suggest starting out with 317 sources like 90% of RSPS coders did

Read full topic
